Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats: one on land and one in water.
The student can include various plants in the land habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can include various animals in the land habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, and ants.
The student can include various plants in the water habitat.
The student can include various animals in the water habitat, such as fish and clams.
The student can use the drawings to compare the different types of living things in each habitat.
The student can show patterns in the diversity of plants and animals across the two habitats.
